hedline.hl2: Elizabeth O'Hara and T. R. Lazo

block.p: Elizabeth Benoit O'Hara, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bartley M. O'Hara of Washington, was married yesterday to Theodore Richard Lazo, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore D. Lazo of Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla. Msgr. Thomas Duffy performed the ceremony at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Washington.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a legislative assistant to Representative Richard A. Gephardt, Democrat of Missouri. She graduated from Washington College in Chestertown, Md. Her father and her mother, Judith Mannion O'Hara, are lawyers in Washington.
Elizabeth Benoit O'Hara was married on Saturday to Theodore Richard Lazo at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Washington.

Elizabeth Benoit O'Hara, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bartley M. O'Hara of Washington, was married yesterday to Theodore Richard Lazo, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore D. Lazo of Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla. Msgr. Thomas Duffy performed the ceremony at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Washington.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a legislative assistant to Representative Richard A. Gephardt, Democrat of Missouri. She graduated from Washington College in Chestertown, Md. Her father and her mother, Judith Mannion O'Hara, are lawyers in Washington.

The bridegroom, 35, is known as T. R. He is a staff lawyer at the Securities and Exchange Commission in Washington. He graduated from Middlebury College and received a law degree from Catholic University of America. His father, who is retired, was the senior vice president of the Drackett Company in Cincinnati, which was a consumer products subsidiary of Bristol-Myers.
